Test Name: Antimicrobial Susceptibility Testing (AST) with Minimal Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) determination for anaerobic bacteria
Specimen Type: Anaerobic clinical specimens (wound exudate, sterile body fluid, tissue biopsy)
Purpose: To determine the antibiotic sensitivity profile of anaerobic bacterial isolates and guide appropriate therapy
Equipment: Anaerobic chamber or anaerobic jars with gas packs, incubator (35–37 °C), antibiotic disks or MIC kits (E-test strips or broth microdilution panels)
